info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 06 at 6:08PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHEASTERN HAMILTON, SOUTHEASTERN BUTLER, NORTHWESTERN CLERMONT AND SOUTHWESTERN WARREN COUNTIES THROUGH 645 PM EDT... At 608 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located near Olde West Chester, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph, half inch hail, and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Hamilton, Fairfield, Mason, Lebanon, Forest Park, Sharonville, Monroe, Blue Ash, Loveland, Springdale, Reading, Montgomery, Wyoming, Milford, West Chester, Ross, Camp Dennison, Highpoint, Remington and Concorde Hills. This includes the following Interstates... I-71 in Ohio between mile markers 13 and 32. I-75 in Ohio between mile markers 13 and 28. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
